phrase.text: Oh, noble Seti, our tyrant Ptolemy and his Roman friends fear you. They have sent their legions to stop our rebellion.
I have sent our best warriors to guard the roads! That will give us enough time to organize our army. Have your priests ensured the loyalty of the nearby villages?
As long as there are priests in the villages, food and peasants will be sent to you.\n\nI also heard that the mercenary leader at the fort south of here wishes to speak with you.
Good! All we need is to withstand some attacks. The Roman army in Egypt is not big enough to endure a long war. If we manage to keep the city, the Romans will have no choice but to leave!
